elements.title: Joseph Redding (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that opera composer and librettist Joseph Redding (pictured) was also a chess polymath and lawyer who won a landmark decision before the United States Supreme Court?

elements.title: Rost (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1920–1922 Tashkent wall newspaper Rost was the first Bukharian-Jewish Soviet newspaper?

elements.title: Joanne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sisters Joanne, Lynette, Amy and Jenny McCarthy were all gymnasts and ten-pin bowlers?

elements.title: Kooraban National Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kooraban National Park provides a habitat for more than twenty endangered animal species, including koalas?

elements.title: Isaac Franklin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a bust of the notorious slave trader Isaac Franklin was placed on the prow of his slave ship, the Isaac Franklin?

elements.title: Manor Lords (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the video game Manor Lords was wishlisted more than three million times on Steam after its developer had estimated it would receive around 14,000?

elements.title: Walid Daqqa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walid Daqqa wrote several works of prison literature, including a children's novel about a boy who uses magical olive oil to visit his imprisoned father?

elements.title: The Star-Spangled Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the production team of the TV series The Falcon and the Winter Soldier created a highway more than five miles (8 km) long to capture visual effects for a truck action sequence for the episode "The Star-Spangled Man"?

elements.title: Neil Sean (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prior to becoming a royal reporter for Fox News, English journalist Neil Sean released a cover of Cliff Richard's "We Don't Talk Anymore" with his mother?
